channel.title: Comments on: Copying data from SQL Studio to Excel
channel.description: Web development notes and commentary from Ryan Stille

item.title: By: Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan
item.description: Yea I've done it that way too, but I've run into problems when there are commas in the data. I don't think SQL Studio escapes them.
item.content:encoded: Yea I’ve done it that way too, but I’ve run into problems when there are commas in the data. I don’t think SQL Studio escapes them.

item.title: By: Jake Churchill
item.dc:creator: Jake Churchill
item.description: Nice post. I usually do the results to text and save as a csv file but then I always have to open that with excel and make sure to re-save as an excel file. This might actually save a step.
item.content:encoded: Nice post. I usually do the results to text and save as a csv file but then I always have to open that with excel and make sure to re-save as an excel file. This might actually save a step.
